009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.subtract;
013
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Vector version (simplified ) with greatly reduced memory requirements.
021 * This code is based on the Anisotropic Diffusion filter proposed by Perona and Malik,
022 * as proposed in [1]. See Sec. 17.3.2 of [2] for additional details.
023 * The filter operates on all types of grayscale (scalar) and RGB color images.
024 * Consult the source code of the related ImageJ plugins for examples.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] Pietro Perona and Jitendra Malik, "Scale-space and edge detection 
028 * using anisotropic diffusion", IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis 
029 * and Machine Intelligence, vol. 12, no. 4, pp. 629-639 (July 1990).
030 * <br>
031 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
032 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2021/01/04
037 */     
038public class PeronaMalikFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements PeronaMalikF {
039        
040        private final float alpha;
041        private final int iterations;           // number of iterations
042        private final ConductanceFunction g;
043        private ColorMode colorMode;
044        
045        // constructor - using default parameters
046        public PeronaMalikFilterVector () {
047                this(new Parameters());
048        }
049        
050        // constructor - use this version to set all parameters
051        public PeronaMalikFilterVector (Parameters params) {
052                this.iterations = params.iterations;
053                this.alpha = (float) params.alpha;
054                this.g = ConductanceFunction.get(params.conductanceFunType, (float)params.kappa);
055                this.colorMode = params.colorMode;
056        }
057        
058        // ------------------------------------------------------
059        
060        @Override
061        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
062                /*   
063                 *  NH pixels:      directions:
064                 *      p4              3
065                 *   p3 p0 p1         2 x 0
066                 *      p2              1
067                 */
068                float[][] A = new float[4][];   // p[i][k]: 4 pixel colors from the 3x3 neigborhood
069                float[] Ac =  pack.getPix(u, v);
070//              A[0] = pack.getVec(u, v);
071                A[0] = pack.getPix(u + 1, v);
072                A[1] = pack.getPix(u, v - 1);
073                A[2] = pack.getPix(u - 1, v);
074                A[3] = pack.getPix(u, v + 1);
075                
076                float[] result = Ac.clone(); //A[0].clone();
077                
078                switch (colorMode) {
079                case BrightnessGradient:
080                        float bc = getBrightness(Ac);
081                        for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
082                                float bi = getBrightness(A[i]);
083                                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
084                                        float gi = g.eval(Math.abs(bi - bc));
085                                        result[k] = result[k] + alpha * gi * (A[i][k] - Ac[k]);
086                                }
087                        }
088                        break;
089                case ColorGradient:
090                        for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
091                                float[] D = subtract(A[i], Ac);
092                                float gi = g.eval(Matrix.normL2(D));    // g applied to color gradient magnitude
093                                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
094                                        result[k] = result[k] + alpha * gi * D[k];
095                                }
096                        }
097                        break;
098                default:
099                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("color mode option " + colorMode.name() +
100                                        " not implemented in class " + this.getClass().getSimpleName());
101                }
102                
103                return result;
104        }
105
106        @Override
107        protected final int passesRequired() {
108                return iterations;      // this filter needs T passes
109        }
110        
111        private final float getBrightness(float[] p) {
112                return 0.299f * p[0] + 0.587f * p[1] + 0.114f * p[2];
113        }
114        
115}
